Package com.rapidminer.belt.reader

Class Readers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.reader.Readers
  • public final class Readers
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for reading one or more Columns.

    Given the column-oriented design of Belt, the readers for single columns perform better than their row-oriented equivalents. For example, using NumericReaders is preferred over using a NumericRowReader.

    Author:
    Gisa Meier, Michael Knopf

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int BEFORE_FIRST_ROW
      The position of a row reader before the first invocation of move().

    • Field Detail

      • BEFORE_FIRST_ROW

        public static final int BEFORE_FIRST_ROW
        The position of a row reader before the first invocation of move(). Calling setPosition(BEFORE_FIRST_ROW) will reset any row reader.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • numericReader

        public static NumericReader numericReader​(Column column)
        Creates a new numeric column reader.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        Returns:
        a reader for a numeric-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null

                                          int length)
        Creates a new numerical column reader.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        length - the number of elements allowed to be read from the start of the column
        Returns:
        a reader for a numeric-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • objectReader

        public static <T> ObjectReader<T> objectReader​(Column column,
                                               java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new object column reader of the given type.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE of the given type
        type - the type as which to read the column
        Returns:
        a reader for an object-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the column element type

      • objectReader

        public static <T> ObjectReader<T> objectReader​(Column column,
                                               java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                               int length)
        Creates a new object column reader of the given type.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE of the given type
        type - the type as which to read the column
        length - the number of elements allowed to be read from the start of the column
        Returns:
        a reader for an object-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column or type is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the column element type

      • numericRowReader

        public static NumericRowReader numericRowReader​(Table table)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise numeric reads of all the columns in the given table. All columns must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, NumericRowReaders do not perform as well as NumericReaders. Thus, whenever possible the use of NumericReaders is preferred.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to read
        Returns:
        a reader for numeric-readable columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the table is null

      • numericRowReader

        public static NumericRowReader numericRowReader​(Column first,
                                                Column second,
                                                Column... other)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise numeric reads of the given columns. All columns must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, NumericRowReaders do not perform as well as NumericReaders. Thus, whenever possible the use of NumericReaders is preferred.

        Parameters:
        first - the first column to read
        second - the second column to read
        other - further columns to read
        Returns:
        a reader for numeric-readable columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the given columns is null

      • numericRowReader

        public static NumericRowReader numericRowReader​(java.util.List<Column> columns)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise numeric reads of the given columns. All columns must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, NumericRowReaders do not perform as well as NumericReaders. Thus, whenever possible the use of NumericReaders is preferred.

        Parameters:
        columns - the columns to read
        Returns:
        a reader for numeric-readable columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source column array is null or contains null columns

      • mixedRowReader

        public static MixedRowReader mixedRowReader​(Table table)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise reads of the given columns.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, MixedRowReaders do not perform as well as column readers such as the NumericReader.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to read
        Returns:
        a reader for arbitrary columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the table is null

      • mixedRowReader

        public static MixedRowReader mixedRowReader​(Column first,
                                            Column second,
                                            Column... other)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise reads of the given columns.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, MixedRowReaders do not perform as well as column readers such as the NumericReader.

        Parameters:
        first - the first column to read
        second - the second column to read
        other - further columns to read
        Returns:
        a reader for arbitrary columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the given columns is null

      • mixedRowReader

        public static MixedRowReader mixedRowReader​(java.util.List<Column> columns)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise reads of the given columns.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, MixedRowReaders do not perform as well as column readers such as the NumericReader.

        Parameters:
        columns - the columns to read
        Returns:
        a reader for arbitrary columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source column array is null or contains null columns

      • categoricalRowReader

        public static CategoricalRowReader categoricalRowReader​(java.util.List<Column> columns)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise categorical reads of the given categorical columns. All columns must be Column.Category.CATEGORICAL.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, CategoricalRowReaders do not perform as well as column readers such as the CategoricalReader.

        Parameters:
        columns - the columns to read
        Returns:
        a reader for categorical columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source column array is null or contains null columns

      • objectRowReader

        public static <T> ObjectRowReader<T> objectRowReader​(java.util.List<Column> columns,
                                                     java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise object reads of the given categorical columns. All columns must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE.

        Given the column-oriented design of Belt, ObjectRowReaders do not perform as well as column readers such as the ObjectReader.

        Parameters:
        columns - the columns to read
        type - the type to read the columns, must be a super type of all column element types
        Returns:
        a reader for object columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source column array is null or contains null columns
